subject: chain runners
msgSnippet: Hello, Is there a way to chain multiple runners? I was thinking of creating an issue for this, but wanted to ask first if I m missing something. Here s the
messageBody:
Hello,

Is there a way to chain multiple runners? I was thinking of creating an
issue for this, but wanted to ask first if I'm missing something.

Here's the motivation: SWTBot includes a runner that automatically saves
screenshots on failures. I also wrote a runner that works around Eclipse
showing failed assumptions as passed tests. In order to use both, I made
my own @MyRunWith annotation. So my test class looks a little like this:

@MyRunWith(SWTBotJunit4ClassRunner.class)
@RunWith(IgnoreFailedAssumptionRunner.class)
public class TestClass {
...
}

IgnoreFailedAssumptionRunner is based on ideas from
http://code.google.com/p/programaticallyspeaking/source/browse/DynamicIg\
nore/src/programmatically/speaking/dynamicignore/RuntimeIgnoreable.java
<http://code.google.com/p/programaticallyspeaking/source/browse/DynamicI\
gnore/src/programmatically/speaking/dynamicignore/RuntimeIgnoreable.java\
> . It creates a delegate runner of the class specified in @MyRunWith.

Now I'd like to use theories or parameterized tests in combination with
both SWTBotJunit4ClassRunner and IgnoreFailedAssumptionRunner, but I
can't see how to do this.

Thanks,

William Kilian




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
